data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly in US Antitrust Case
data.Description: A US federal judge has ruled that Google holds a monopoly in the search market, setting the stage for potential actions to limit its dominance. The ruling could have significant implications for the tech giant and the search industry as a whole.

data.Title: Apple Rejects Bing as Default Search Engine, Even With Microsoft's Offer of Entire Company
data.Description: Apple has firmly rejected Microsoft's Bing as the default search engine for its Safari browser, even if Microsoft were to offer the entire company. Apple cites Bing's poor ad monetization and Google's unmatched revenue share as reasons for its decision.

data.Title: Google Ads to Transition Smart Campaigns Functionality to Performance Max
data.Description: Google Ads will be transitioning the functionality of Smart Campaigns into Performance Max campaigns in the coming months. Google claims that Performance Max offers all the benefits of Smart Campaigns and more.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Performance Report No Longer Shows Call Data
data.Description: The Google Business Profiles performance report has stopped displaying the "call" tab, which provided statistics and data on searchers who called businesses from Google Search and Google Maps. This change may be related to the recent removal of Google Business Profile call history.

data.Title: Apple Maintains a Search Index of Billions of Websites
data.Description: Documents revealed during the DOJ's antitrust ruling against Google disclose that Apple maintains its own search index, encompassing billions of websites. The specific number remains redacted, but the revelation sheds light on Apple's search capabilities.

data.Title: Google Ads Tests Displaying Advertiser's Name on Call Extensions
data.Description: Google Ads is experimenting with a new call extension ad format that displays the advertiser's name below the clickable phone number. This change aims to enhance the visibility of the phone number and the call-to-action for call extensions.

data.Title: Google Search Console Introduces "Recommendations" Feature
data.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out a new "Recommendations" feature, providing website owners with personalized SEO advice. These recommendations, based on Search Console data, aim to enhance website performance in Google Search.

data.Title: Google Ads to Issue Credits for Serving Ads with Incorrect Product Data
data.Description: Google Ads experienced a significant reporting outage on August 1st due to a bug that caused ads to display products from incorrect Google Merchant Center accounts. Google acknowledges the issue as a privacy and data concern and plans to issue credits to affected advertisers.

data.Title: Google Trends Unveils Redesigned Trending Now Page
data.Description: Google Trends has introduced a new design for its trending now page, offering enhanced filter options and more comprehensive keyword data on a single page.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Testing "See Also" Carousel with Competitors
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a "see also" carousel on Google Business Profiles, potentially displaying competitor suggestions directly beneath a business's local listing. This feature could impact user behavior and competition among local businesses.

data.Title: Microsoft Bing Receives AI-Powered Enhancements
data.Description: Microsoft has updated its Bing search engine with AI capabilities, aiming to provide more accurate and relevant search results. The revamped Bing prioritizes publisher interests and accuracy over revenue generation, differentiating itself from Google's approach.

data.Title: RIAA Supports AI Copyright Lawsuit Against Anthropic
data.Description: The Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) has expressed support for a copyright lawsuit against AI company Anthropic, drawing parallels to the Napster case. The lawsuit alleges that Anthropic's AI model, Claude, infringes on music copyrights.

data.Title: OpenAI Develops Watermarking Method for Detecting ChatGPT-Generated Text
data.Description: OpenAI has created a watermarking technique that can identify text generated by its ChatGPT model with 99.9% accuracy. However, the company has yet to release the tool due to internal discussions and concerns about potential misuse.

data.Title: YouTuber Initiates Class Action Lawsuit Against OpenAI for Scraping Video Transcripts
data.Description: A YouTuber has filed a class action lawsuit against OpenAI, alleging that the company scraped video transcripts without permission to train its AI models. The lawsuit highlights growing concerns about data privacy and copyright infringement in the age of AI.
